name: John Smith
bio: John Smith is an experienced football instructor. He leads the Football BM201 class, focusing on teamwork, discipline, communication, and physical fitness. With a duration of 9 weeks, this program provides ample time for children aged 10-14 to develop their football skills. Limited seats are available to ensure individual attention and personalized coaching.

name: David Johnson
bio: David Johnson is a skilled chess instructor. He leads the Chess CL401 class, focusing on teaching the fundamentals of chess, including openings, tactics, and endgame strategies. With a duration of 12 weeks, this program offers ample time for children aged 8-12 to dive deep into the world of chess and sharpen their minds.

name: Ryan Lee
bio: Ryan Lee is a dedicated badminton instructor. He leads the Badminton BT269 class, focusing on teaching the fundamentals of badminton, including proper grip, footwork, strokes, and game strategies. With a duration of 6 weeks, this program provides a structured environment for children aged 10-14 to develop their badminton skills.

name: Daniel Kim
bio: Daniel Kim is an enthusiastic table tennis instructor. He leads the Table Tennis TTL501 class, focusing on teaching the techniques of table tennis, including grip, stance, strokes, and strategies. With a duration of 8 weeks, this program offers students aged 12-16 an opportunity to improve their table tennis skills.

name: Jason Thompson
bio: Jason Thompson is a passionate basketball instructor. He leads the Basketball BD211 class, focusing on teaching fundamental basketball skills such as dribbling, shooting, passing, and team strategies. The class spans 10 weeks, catering to children aged 10-14, and provides a fun and engaging environment for skill development.

name: Michael Thompson
bio: Michael Thompson is a dedicated tennis instructor. He leads the Tennis TC205 class, focusing on teaching proper techniques, footwork, shot placement, and strategy. This 8-week program caters to beginners and intermediate-level players, providing a supportive and encouraging environment for skill development.

name: David Krasner
bio: David Krasner is an experienced gymnastics coach. He leads the Gymnastics GL102 class, focusing on teaching various gymnastic techniques, flexibility, strength, and performance skills. With a duration of 12 weeks, this program provides a structured learning environment for children aged 6-12 to explore and excel in gymnastics.

name: Jonathan Davis
bio: Jonathan Davis is a passionate volleyball instructor. He leads the Volleyball VC201 class, focusing on teaching fundamental volleyball skills, including serving, setting, spiking, and teamwork. The class spans 8 weeks, catering to beginners and intermediate-level players, and provides a supportive and dynamic learning environment.

name: Matthew Anderson
bio: Matthew Anderson is a dedicated hockey instructor. He leads the Hockey HC123 class, focusing on teaching essential hockey skills such as stick handling, passing, shooting, and game strategy. The class spans 10 weeks and provides a supportive and engaging environment for children aged 8-12 to develop their hockey skills.

name: Daniel Kim
bio: Daniel Kim is an experienced swimming instructor. He leads the Swimming SC202 class, focusing on teaching swimming techniques, water safety, and stroke refinement. With a duration of 8 weeks, this program provides ample time for children aged 8-12 to dive into the world of swimming and improve their abilities. Limited seats are available to ensure personalized attention and coaching. Through engaging drills, practice sessions, and fun water activities, participants will enhance their water confidence, endurance, teamwork, and self-discipline. Join Daniel Kim's swimming class this summer camp and give your child the opportunity to develop important life skills while enjoying the joy of swimming!
